translated: 3Here is the corrected and aligned text:ğŸ”½MahÄprajÃ±ÄpÄramitÄ-sÅ«tra, Scroll 307
Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang on Imperial Order
Chapter 41, Part 3: The Mother of the Buddha, Section on the First Part
The Buddha said:
SubhÅ«ti!
Because profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ does not give rise to consciousness in dependence on form, it is called demonstrating the characteristics of form because form is not seen.

Because it does not give rise to consciousness in dependence on feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness, it is called demonstrating the characteristics of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness because feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are not seen.
Because it does not give rise to consciousness in dependence on the eye faculty, it is called demonstrating the characteristics of the eye faculty because the eye faculty is not seen.

Because it does not give rise to consciousness in dependence on the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind faculty, it is called demonstrating the characteristics of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind faculties because the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind faculties are not seen.
Because it does not give rise to consciousness in dependence on the form faculty, it is called demonstrating the characteristics of the form faculty because the form faculty is not seen.
It does not arise in dependence on the sphere of sound, smell, taste, touch, or dharmas, and thus it is said to be not seeing the sphere of sound, smell, taste, touch, or dharmas.
It does not arise in dependence on the eye-faculty, and thus it is said to be not seeing the eye-faculty.

It does not arise in dependence on the form-sphere, eye-consciousness, eye-contact, or the feelings produced by eye-contact, and thus it is said to be not seeing the form-sphere up to the feelings produced by eye-contact.
It does not arise in dependence on the ear-faculty, and thus it is said to be not seeing the ear-faculty.

Not giving rise to consciousness in relation to the sound element, ear-consciousness element, and ear-contact, and the feelings that arise from ear-contact as a condition, is called not seeing the sound element, up to the feelings that arise from ear-contact as a condition, and is called demonstrating the characteristics of the sound element, up to the feelings that arise from ear-contact as a condition.
Not giving rise to consciousness in relation to the nose element is called not seeing the nose element, and is called demonstrating the characteristics of the nose element;

Not giving rise to consciousness in relation to the smell element, nose-consciousness element, and nose-contact, and the feelings that arise from nose-contact as a condition, is called not seeing the smell element, up to the feelings that arise from nose-contact as a condition, and is called demonstrating the characteristics of the smell element, up to the feelings that arise from nose-contact as a condition.
Not giving rise to consciousness in relation to the tongue element is called not seeing the tongue element, and is called demonstrating the characteristics of the tongue element;

Not giving rise to consciousness in relation to the tongue element, tongue consciousness element, tongue contact, or the feelings that arise from tongue contact as a condition, this is called not seeing the tongue element, up to the feelings that arise from tongue contact as a condition, and is called demonstrating the characteristics of the tongue element, up to the feelings that arise from tongue contact as a condition.
Not giving rise to consciousness in relation to the body element, this is called not seeing the body element, and is called demonstrating the characteristics of the body element;

Not giving rise to consciousness in relation to the tactile element, body consciousness element, body contact, or the feelings that arise from body contact as a condition, this is called not seeing the tactile element, up to the feelings that arise from body contact as a condition, and is called demonstrating the characteristics of the tactile element, up to the feelings that arise from body contact as a condition.
Not giving rise to consciousness in relation to the mind element, this is called not seeing the mind element, and is called demonstrating the characteristics of the mind element;

It does not give rise to consciousness by relying on the dharma realm, the mental consciousness realm, and the mental contact and mental contact as a condition that gives rise to feelings, this is called not seeing the dharma realm up to the mental contact and mental contact as a condition that gives rise to feelings, and is called demonstrating the characteristics of the dharma realm up to the mental contact and mental contact as a condition that gives rise to feelings.
By not relying on the earth element to give rise to consciousness, this is called not seeing the earth element, and is called demonstrating the characteristics of the earth element;

not relying on the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements to give rise to consciousness, this is called not seeing the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements, and is called demonstrating the characteristics of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements.
By not relying on ignorance to give rise to consciousness, this is called not seeing ignorance, and is called demonstrating the characteristics of ignorance;

It does not arise in dependence on formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, aging and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress. This is called the characteristic of aging and death because of not seeing formations up to aging and death.
It does not arise in dependence on the perfection of giving, and therefore it is called the characteristic of the perfection of giving because of not seeing the perfection of giving;

it does not arise in dependence on the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, or wisdom, and therefore it is called the characteristic of the perfection of morality up to the perfection of wisdom because of not seeing the perfection of morality up to the perfection of wisdom.
It does not arise in dependence on inner emptiness, and therefore it is called the characteristic of inner emptiness because of not seeing inner emptiness;

It does not give rise to consciousness in relation to external emptiness, internal and external emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of dispersion, emptiness of invariance, emptiness of inherent nature, emptiness of specific characteristics, emptiness of common characteristics, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of nature, emptiness of self-nature, or emptiness of the nature of self-nature of phenomena. This is called not seeing external emptiness up to the emptiness of the nature of self-nature of phenomena, and is therefore called demonstrating the characteristics of external emptiness up to the emptiness of the nature of self-nature of phenomena.

Not giving rise to consciousness by taking true suchness as a condition is called demonstrating the characteristic of true suchness because one does not see true suchness. Not giving rise to consciousness by taking the dharma realm, dharma nature, non-false nature, unchanging nature, equality nature, nature free from arising, dharma determination, dharma abiding, ultimate reality, space realm, and inconceivable realm as conditions is called demonstrating the characteristic of the dharma realm up to the inconceivable realm because one does not see the dharma realm up to the inconceivable realm.

Not giving rise to consciousness by taking the noble truth of suffering as a condition is called demonstrating the characteristic of the noble truth of suffering because one does not see the noble truth of suffering.

Not giving rise to consciousness by taking the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path as conditions is called demonstrating the characteristic of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path because one does not see the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path.

Not giving rise to consciousness by taking the four concentrations as a condition is called demonstrating the characteristic of the four concentrations because one does not see the four concentrations.

Not taking the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations as a basis for the arising of consciousness is called 'not seeing the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations,' and therefore it is called 'indicating the characteristics of the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations.'

Not taking the eight liberations as a basis for the arising of consciousness is called 'not seeing the eight liberations,' and therefore it is called 'indicating the characteristics of the eight liberations';

not taking the eight superior realms, nine successive concentrations, and ten universal bases as a basis for the arising of consciousness is called 'not seeing the eight superior realms, nine successive concentrations, and ten universal bases,' and therefore it is called 'indicating the characteristics of the eight superior realms, nine successive concentrations, and ten universal bases.'

Not taking the four establishments of mindfulness as a basis for the arising of consciousness is called 'not seeing the four establishments of mindfulness,' and therefore it is called 'indicating the characteristics of the four establishments of mindfulness';

It does not give rise to consciousness by relying on the four right efforts, four legs of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, or eightfold noble path, and thus it is called showing the characteristics of the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path because it does not see the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path.

It does not give rise to consciousness by relying on the gate of liberation of emptiness, and thus it is called showing the characteristics of the gate of liberation of emptiness because it does not see the gate of liberation of emptiness;

it does not give rise to consciousness by relying on the gate of liberation of signlessness or the gate of liberation of wishlessness, and thus it is called showing the characteristics of the gate of liberation of signlessness and the gate of liberation of wishlessness because it does not see the gate of liberation of signlessness or the gate of liberation of wishlessness.

It does not give rise to consciousness by relying on the ten grounds of the bodhisattva, and thus it is called showing the characteristics of the ten grounds of the bodhisattva because it does not see the ten grounds of the bodhisattva.
It does not give rise to consciousness by relying on the five eyes, and thus it is called showing the characteristics of the five eyes because it does not see the five eyes;
Not taking the six supernormal knowledges as a basis for the arising of consciousness is called showing the characteristics of the six supernormal knowledges because they are not seen.
Not taking the Buddha's ten powers as a basis for the arising of consciousness is called showing the characteristics of the Buddha's ten powers because they are not seen;

not taking the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha as a basis for the arising of consciousness is called showing the characteristics of the four fearlessnesses up to the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha because they are not seen.

Not taking the quality of being free from forgetfulness as a basis for the arising of consciousness is called showing the characteristics of the quality of being free from forgetfulness because it is not seen;

not taking the nature of always abiding in equanimity as a basis for the arising of consciousness is called showing the characteristics of the nature of always abiding in equanimity because it is not seen.
Not giving rise to consciousness based on omniscience is called demonstrating the characteristic of omniscience because it is not seeing omniscience.

Not giving rise to consciousness based on the cognition of the characteristics of the path and the cognition of all aspects is called demonstrating the characteristic of the cognition of the characteristics of the path and the cognition of all aspects because it is not seeing the cognition of the characteristics of the path and the cognition of all aspects.
Not giving rise to consciousness based on all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways is called demonstrating the characteristic of all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways because it is not seeing all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways.
Not giving rise to consciousness based on all samÄdhi gateways is called demonstrating the characteristic of all samÄdhi gateways because it is not seeing all samÄdhi gateways.
Not giving rise to consciousness based on the fruit of stream-entry is called demonstrating the characteristic of the fruit of stream-entry because it is not seeing the fruit of stream-entry.

It does not give rise to consciousness by taking the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, or the fruit of arhatship as its object. This is called showing the characteristics of the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, and the fruit of arhatship because one does not see the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, or the fruit of arhatship.

It does not give rise to consciousness by taking the pratyekabuddha's enlightenment as its object. This is called showing the characteristics of the pratyekabuddha's enlightenment because one does not see the pratyekabuddha's enlightenment.

It does not give rise to consciousness by taking the practices of all bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas as its object. This is called showing the characteristics of the practices of all bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas because one does not see the practices of all bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas.

It does not give rise to consciousness by taking the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of all buddhas as its object. This is called showing the characteristics of the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of all buddhas because one does not see the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of all buddhas.
SubhÅ«ti!
For this reason, the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ can show the true characteristics of the world of all buddhas and is called the mother of all buddhas.
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!
The profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ can reveal the emptiness of the world for the buddhas, and is therefore called the mother of the buddhas, able to show the buddhas the true nature of the world.
World-Honored One!
How is it that prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ can reveal the emptiness of the world for the buddhas?
SubhÅ«ti!
The profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ can reveal the emptiness of the world of form for the buddhas, and reveal the emptiness of the world of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness;
It can reveal the emptiness of the world of the eye-faculty, and reveal the emptiness of the world of the ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, and mind-faculties;
It can reveal the emptiness of the world of the form-realm, and reveal the emptiness of the world of the sound-, smell-, taste-, touch-, and dharma-realms;

It can reveal the emptiness of the world of the eye-element, and reveal the emptiness of the world of the form element, eye-consciousness element, and eye-contact, as well as the feelings produced by eye-contact;

It manifests the emptiness of the world of the ear sense base, and manifests the emptiness of the world of the sound sense base, the ear consciousness sense base, ear contact, and the feelings produced from ear contact as a condition;ğŸ”½It manifests the emptiness of the world of the nose sense base, and manifests the emptiness of the world of the smell sense base, the nose consciousness sense base, nose contact, and the feelings produced from nose contact as a condition;

It manifests the emptiness of the world of the tongue sense base, and manifests the emptiness of the world of the taste sense base, the tongue consciousness sense base, tongue contact, and the feelings produced from tongue contact as a condition;

It manifests the emptiness of the world of the body sense base, and manifests the emptiness of the world of the touch sense base, the body consciousness sense base, body contact, and the feelings produced from body contact as a condition;

It manifests the emptiness of the world of the mind sense base, and manifests the emptiness of the world of the dharma sense base, the mind consciousness sense base, mind contact, and the feelings produced from mind contact as a condition;
It manifests the emptiness of the world of the earth element, and manifests the emptiness of the world of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements;

It reveals the emptiness of the world of ignorance, and reveals the emptiness of the world of volitional formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, depression, and anguish.
It reveals the emptiness of the world of the perfection of generosity, and reveals the emptiness of the world of the perfections of morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom.

It reveals the emptiness of the world of inner emptiness, and reveals the emptiness of the world of outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of non-dispersal, emptiness of inherent existence, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of intrinsic nature, emptiness of intrinsic nature of non-entities, and emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

It reveals the emptiness of the world of suchness, and reveals the emptiness of the world of the dharma realm, the nature of dharmas, the nature of non-falseness, the nature of immutability, the nature of equality, the nature of detachment from birth, the determination of dharmas, the abiding of dharmas, the ultimate reality, the realm of space, and the inconceivable realm;
It reveals the emptiness of the world of the noble truth of suffering, and reveals the emptiness of the world of the noble truths of the origination, cessation, and path of suffering;
It reveals the emptiness of the world of the four meditations, and reveals the emptiness of the world of the four immeasurable [minds] and four formless concentrations;
It reveals the emptiness of the world of the eight liberations, and reveals the emptiness of the world of the eight spheres of mastery, nine successive concentrations, and ten universal bases;

It reveals the emptiness of the world of the four establishments of mindfulness, and reveals the emptiness of the world of the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path;
It reveals the emptiness of the world of the gate of liberation of emptiness, and reveals the emptiness of the world of the gate of liberation of signlessness and wishlessness;
It reveals the emptiness of the world of the ten grounds of the bodhisattvas;
manifesting the five eyes as the emptiness of the world, manifesting the six supernormal knowledges as the emptiness of the world;

manifesting the ten powers of the buddhas as the emptiness of the world, manifesting the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and eighteen distinctive abilities of the buddhas as the emptiness of the world;
manifesting the power of recollection as the emptiness of the world, manifesting the power of abiding in relinquishment as the emptiness of the world;
manifesting omniscience as the emptiness of the world, manifesting the cognition of the path and the cognition of all aspects as the emptiness of the world;
manifesting all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways as the emptiness of the world, manifesting all samÄdhi gateways as the emptiness of the world;
manifesting the fruit of entering the stream as the emptiness of the world, manifesting the fruits of the once-returner, non-returner, and arhat as the emptiness of the world;
manifesting the enlightenment of the pratyekabuddhas as the emptiness of the world;
manifesting all the practices of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas as the emptiness of the world;
manifesting the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of the buddhas as the emptiness of the world.
SubhÅ«ti!
For this reason, profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ can reveal the true characteristics of the world to buddhas, and is called the mother of buddhas.
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti,

profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ enables tathÄgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened ones to cause the world to experience the emptiness of the world, to think of the emptiness of the world, to understand the emptiness of the world, and to realize the emptiness of the world.
SubhÅ«ti,
for this reason, profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ can reveal the true characteristics of the world to buddhas, and is called the mother of buddhas.
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti,
profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ can reveal to buddhas the empty characteristics of the world, and is called the mother of buddhas, able to reveal the true characteristics of the world to buddhas.
World-Honored One,
how can prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ reveal to buddhas the empty characteristics of the world?
SubhÅ«ti,

The profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ can reveal to the buddhas the characteristics of the emptiness of the world of form, the characteristics of the emptiness of the world of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness;

It can reveal to the buddhas the characteristics of the emptiness of the world of the eye faculty, the characteristics of the emptiness of the world of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind faculties;

It can reveal to the buddhas the characteristics of the emptiness of the world of the form faculty, the characteristics of the emptiness of the world of sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects;

It can reveal to the buddhas the characteristics of the emptiness of the world of the eye element, the characteristics of the emptiness of the world of the form element, the eye-consciousness element, and eye contact and the feelings produced from eye contact;

It can reveal to the buddhas the characteristics of the emptiness of the world of the ear element, the characteristics of the emptiness of the world of the sound element, the ear-consciousness element, and ear contact and the feelings produced from ear contact;

It can reveal to the buddhas the characteristics of the emptiness of the world of the nose element, the characteristics of the emptiness of the world of the smell element, the nose-consciousness element, and nose contact and the feelings produced from nose contact;

They can reveal to all buddhas the empty characteristics of the tongue sense base, the empty characteristics of the flavor sense base, the tongue consciousness sense base, tongue contact, and the feelings produced from tongue contact as a condition in the world;

They can reveal to all buddhas the empty characteristics of the body sense base in the world, the empty characteristics of the tactile sense base, the body consciousness sense base, body contact, and the feelings produced from body contact as a condition in the world;

They can reveal to all buddhas the empty characteristics of the mind sense base in the world, the empty characteristics of the dharma sense base, the mind consciousness sense base, mind contact, and the feelings produced from mind contact as a condition in the world;
They can reveal to all buddhas the empty characteristics of the earth element in the world, the empty characteristics of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements in the world;

They can reveal to all buddhas the empty characteristics of ignorance in the world, the empty characteristics of karmic formations, consciousness, name and form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, dejection, and mental anguish in the world;

They can reveal to all buddhas the worldly empty characteristics of the perfection of giving, and the worldly empty characteristics of morality, patience, diligence, meditation, and wisdom;ğŸ”½They can reveal to all buddhas the worldly empty characteristics of inner emptiness, the worldly empty characteristics of outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of dispersion, emptiness of inherent existence, emptiness of specific characteristics, emptiness of common characteristics, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of nature, emptiness of intrinsic nature, and emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence;

They can reveal to all buddhas the worldly empty characteristics of suchness, the worldly empty characteristics of the dharma realm, dharma nature, non-false nature, immutability, equality, detachment from production, dharma determination, dharma abiding, reality limit, space element, and inconceivable element;

They can reveal to the buddhas the worldly empty characteristics of the noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the accumulation [of suffering], the noble truth of the cessation [of suffering], and the noble truth of the path [to the cessation of suffering];
They can reveal to the buddhas the worldly empty characteristics of the four meditations, the four immeasurable [minds], and the four formless concentrations;
They can reveal to the buddhas the worldly empty characteristics of the eight liberations, the eight superior [meditations], the nine successive concentrations, and the ten universal bases;

They can reveal to the buddhas the worldly empty characteristics of the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of enlightenment, and the eightfold noble path;
They can reveal to the buddhas the worldly empty characteristics of the gate of liberation of emptiness, the gate of liberation of signlessness, and the gate of liberation of wishlessness;
They can reveal to the buddhas the worldly empty characteristics of the ten grounds of the bodhisattvas;
They can reveal to the buddhas the worldly empty characteristics of the five eyes and the six supernatural powers;

It can reveal to buddhas the worldly empty characteristics of the ten powers of the buddhas, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of the buddhas, and it can reveal to buddhas the worldly empty characteristics of the buddhas' unforgetting quality and the constant abiding of relinquishment;
It can reveal to buddhas the worldly empty characteristics of the buddhas' knowledge of all modes, the knowledge of paths, and the knowledge of all aspects;
It can reveal to buddhas the worldly empty characteristics of the buddhas' dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateway and the samÄdhi gateway;
It can reveal to buddhas the worldly empty characteristics of the buddhas' result of stream-entry, the result of once-returning, the result of non-returning, and the result of arhatship;
It can reveal to buddhas the worldly empty characteristics of pratyekabuddha enlightenment;
It can reveal to buddhas the worldly empty characteristics of all the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva practices;
It can reveal to buddhas the worldly empty characteristics of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.
SubhÅ«ti!
For this reason, the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ can reveal to the buddhas the true characteristics of the world, and is called the mother of the buddhas.
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!

The profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ can reveal to the buddhas the inconceivable characteristics of the world, and is called the mother of the buddhas, able to reveal to the buddhas the true characteristics of the world.
World-Honored One!
How can prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ reveal to the buddhas the inconceivable characteristics of the world?
SubhÅ«ti!

The profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ can reveal to the buddhas the inconceivable characteristics of the world of form, the inconceivable characteristics of the world of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness;
it can reveal to the buddhas the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the eye-faculty, the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, and mind-faculties;

able to manifest the inconceivable characteristics of the form realm in the world of the buddhas, the inconceivable characteristics of the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma realms in the world of the buddhas;

able to manifest the inconceivable characteristics of the eye realm in the world of the buddhas, the inconceivable characteristics of the form realm, eye consciousness realm, eye contact, and the feelings produced by eye contact in the world of the buddhas;

able to manifest the inconceivable characteristics of the ear realm in the world of the buddhas, the inconceivable characteristics of the sound realm, ear consciousness realm, ear contact, and the feelings produced by ear contact in the world of the buddhas;

able to manifest the inconceivable characteristics of the nose realm in the world of the buddhas, the inconceivable characteristics of the smell realm, nose consciousness realm, nose contact, and the feelings produced by nose contact in the world of the buddhas;

able to manifest the inconceivable characteristics of the tongue realm in the world of the buddhas, the inconceivable characteristics of the taste realm, tongue consciousness realm, tongue contact, and the feelings produced by tongue contact in the world of the buddhas;

It can reveal the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the Buddha's body realm, the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the body element, body consciousness element, body contact, and the feelings produced from body contact as a condition;

It can reveal the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the Buddha's mind realm, the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the dharma element, mind consciousness element, mind contact, and the feelings produced from mind contact as a condition;
It can reveal the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the Buddha's earth element, the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements;

It can reveal the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the Buddha's ignorance, the inconceivable characteristics of the world of formations, consciousness, name-and-form, six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, depression, and distress;

It can reveal the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the perfection of generosity of all buddhas, and the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the perfections of morality, patience, diligence, meditation, and wisdom;

It can reveal the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the emptiness of internal phenomena of all buddhas, the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the great emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the ultimate, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, the emptiness of dispersion, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of specific characteristics, the emptiness of common characteristics, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of nature, the emptiness of intrinsic nature, and the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence.

It can reveal to all buddhas the inconceivable characteristics of the world of suchness, the realm of reality, the nature of reality, the unmistaken nature, the unchanging nature, the nature of equality, the nature of detachment from birth, the determination of phenomena, the abiding of phenomena, the ultimate reality, the realm of space, and the inconceivable realm.

It can reveal to all buddhas the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the accumulation of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path.
It can reveal to all buddhas the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the four concentrations, the four immeasurable [minds], and the four formless concentrations.

It can reveal to all buddhas the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the eight liberations, the eight superior [meditative] states, the nine successive concentrations, and the ten universal bases.

It can reveal the inconceivable characteristics of the four establishments of mindfulness in the world, the four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the eightfold noble path in the world;
It can reveal the inconceivable characteristics of the emptiness liberation gate in the world, the signless and wishless liberation gates in the world;
It can reveal the inconceivable characteristics of the ten grounds of bodhisattvas in the world;
It can reveal the inconceivable characteristics of the five eyes in the world, and the six supernatural powers in the world;

It can reveal the inconceivable characteristics of the ten powers of the Buddha in the world, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha in the world;

It can reveal the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the Buddha's unforgetting Dharma, and the inconceivable characteristics of the world of constant abiding in the nature of abandonment;ğŸ”½It can reveal the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the Buddha's omniscience, and the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the cognition of the path and the cognition of all aspects;
It can reveal the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the Buddha's all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways, and the inconceivable characteristics of the world of all samÄdhi gateways;

It can reveal the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the Buddha's stream-winner fruit, and the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the once-returner, non-returner, and arhat fruits;
It can reveal the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the Buddha's pratyekabuddha enlightenment;
It can reveal the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the Buddha's all bodhisattva-mahÄsattva practices;
It can reveal the inconceivable characteristics of the world of the Buddha's unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.
SubhÅ«ti!
For this reason, profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ can reveal to buddhas the true characteristics of the world, and is called the mother of buddhas.
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti,
profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ can reveal to buddhas the characteristics of the world's detachment, and is called the mother of buddhas, able to reveal to buddhas the true characteristics of the world.
World-Honored One,
how can prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ reveal to buddhas the characteristics of the world's detachment?
SubhÅ«ti,
